Author: Mount Locker
Description: Amey Plc, the British company providing infrastructure support services reveals to have suffered a ransomware attack since mid-December 2020.
Target Class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: Thallium
Target: Users of a private stock investment messenger service
Description: Researchers from ESTsecurity reveal that North Korean hacking group Thallium has targeted users of a private stock investment messenger service.
This week a threat actor leaks the data of 10,000 Mexico-based American Express credit cardholders on a forum.
The same threat actor leaks the data of several Santander credit cardholders
The same threat actor leaks the data of several Banamex credit cardholders
A new SMS text phishing (smishing) campaign pretends to be from PayPal, stating that the victim's account has been permanently limited unless they verify it by clicking on a link.
Researchers from Cyble discover a trove of more than 200 million records of Chinese citizens for sale on the dark web. The alleged leaks could be related to Gongan County, Weibo, and QQ.
Aurora Cannabis says it experienced a “cybersecurity incident” over the holidays. The incident took place on Dec. 25.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Exclusive Networks reveals it has been hit by a cyber breach, affecting the cyber security distributor's systems across five countries (UK, US, France, Singapore, and the UAE) with the breach resulting in unauthorized access to data.
Target Class: N Administrative and support service activities

Author: APT27, AKA TG-3390, Emissary Panda, BRONZE UNION, Iron Tiger, and LuckyMouse.
Target: At least five companies in the online gambling sector
Description: Researchers from Profero and Security Joes reveal the details of a ransomware campaign involving APT28, a Chinese group normally involved in cyber espionage operations.
Tags: Profero, Security Joes, APT28, TG-3390, Emissary Panda, BRONZE UNION, Iron Tiger, LuckyMouse

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: A research from Kela reveals finds nearly 1 million compromised accounts pertaining to gaming clients and employees in the dark web, with 50% of them offered for sale.

Author: FIN7
Description: Researchers at Morphisec Labs publish details about a malware variant called JSSLoader used by the FIN7 hacking group.
Lake Regional Healthcare experiences a ransomware attack that disrupted its computer system.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: Perth Amboy School District discloses a phishing incident.

Multiple code repositories from Nissan North America become public after the company leaves an exposed Git server protected with default access credentials. The entire collection is around 20 gigabytes large and contains source code for mobile apps and various tools used by Nissan.

Researchers from Intezer discover a new remote access trojan, dubbed ElectroRAT, written in Golang, that lures cryptocurrency users to download trojanized apps on Windows, Mac and Linux machines by promoting the apps in dedicated online forums and on social media.

Author: Earth Wendigo
Target: Government organizations, research institutions and universities in Taiwan
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new campaign targeting several organizations, including government organizations, research institutions and universities in Taiwan, aiming to exfiltrate emails from targeted organizations via the injection of JavaScript backdoors to a webmail system that is widely-used in Taiwan.

Author: Babuk Locker
Description: Several security researchers discover Babuk Locker, the first ransomware operation of 2021.

Author: Avaddon
Description: The Belgian consultancy firm Finalyse emerges unscathed from an Avaddon ransomware attack being able to restore the data from a backup despite the group leaks 98 GB of data.
Target Class: N Administrative and support service activities

Description: The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) warns about a social engineering campaign featuring phishing emails and scam calls that impersonate the ACSC.

Author: APT37 AKA ScarCruft, Reaper, and Group123
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal the details of a campaign carried out by the North Korean group APT37, targeting the South Korean government via the RokRat trojan.
Target Class: O Public administration and defence, compulsory social security
Tags: Malwarebytes,  North Korean, APT37, ScarCruft, Reaper, Group123, RokRat

Author: Egregor
Description: The FBI sends a security alert warning private sector companies that the Egregor ransomware operation is actively targeting and extorting businesses worldwide.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors are actively scanning the Internet for open SSH devices and trying to login to them using a new recently patched Zyxel hardcoded credential backdoor.
Researchers from Trustwave reveal the details of a new phishing campaign distribution the QRAT malware via a fake video of the President Donald Trump.
The Ben-Gurion University reveals to have been hit with a cyber attack.

Window to the World Communications alerts employees to the discovery of a data breach in its computer system.. Emails and personal information of approximately 40 staffers were hacked between December 2018 and August 2020
The Taiwanese National Communications Commission (NCC) orders Taiwan Mobile to recall all of its self-branded, China-made smartphones after the phones’ built-in software is found to contain malware.
Tags: Taiwanese National Communications Commission, NCC, Taiwan Mobile

Author: ALTDOS
Description: Threat actors calling themselves ALTDOS claim to have hacked several companies of the Mono conglomerate, being able to exfiltrate hundreds of gigabytes of data and asking a ransom for the data.
Security researchers at AT&T’s Alien Labs identify multiple malware attacks leveraging the Ezuri memory loader to execute payloads without writing them to disk.

Author: TA551, AKA Shathak
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Unit 42 reveal the details of a new campaign targeting  German, Italian and Japanese speakers with the IcedID info-stealer.
Tags: Palo Alto Unit 42, IcedID, TA551, Shathak

Description: The Royal Dutch Touring Club sends an email to former and current members to warn them that their data may have been compromised in a cyber attack, not directly on their systems but on a collection agency (Trust Krediet Beheer BV).
Tags: Royal Dutch Touring Club, Trust Krediet Beheer BV, ANWB

Author: TeamTNT
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new version of the TeamTNT botnet able to collect Docker API credentials, on top of the AWS creds-stealing code.
Tags: Trend Micro,  TeamTNT, Docker API, AWS

Date Occurred: Between Christmas 2020 and the Beginning of 20201
Author: Charming Kitten (APT35 or Phosphorus)
Target: Members of think tanks, political research centers, university professors, journalists, and environmental activists
Description: Researchers from CERTFA discover a new campaign by the Iranian cyber-espionage group Charming Kitten targeting individuals from all over the world using a very sophisticated spear-phishing campaign that involved not only email attacks but also SMS messages.
the Montreal carsharing service Communauto notifies to have suffered a ransomware attack.
Mascoutah School District 19 discloses a malware incident.

Tasmania’s ambulance paging system is breached exposing the records of every Tasmanian that has requested an ambulance since November 2020. The breached sensitive data is published online to an undisclosed website that is then blocked.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Author: Conti
Description: Colorado-based short line rail operator and logistics provider OmniTRAX was is by a Conti ransomware attack
Reserve Bank of New Zealand reveals that a file sharing service provided by California-based Accellion was illegally accessed.
Tags: Reserve Bank of New Zealand, Accellion

Description: Bollywood actress Esha Deol has her Instagram account hacked and warns her followers not to click on links from her direct messages (DMs) due to the hack

Email security provider Mimecast discloses that hackers had hijacked its products in order to spy on its customers, after “a sophisticated threat actor” had compromised the certificate used to guard connections between its products and Microsoft’s cloud services. Around 10% of its more than 36,000 customers had been affected, but it believed “a low single digit number” of users had been specifically targeted.
Target Class: M Professional scientific and technical activities

Description: 5 million records (usernames and passwords) of French users are on sale on a black market.
A threat actor claims to have leaked about 1 million records stoken by the Canadian telco company Vidèotron

Networking device maker Ubiquiti Networks announces a security incident that may have exposed customers' data. The company emails customers to change their passwords and enable 2FA after an attacker hacked their systems hosted at a third-party cloud provider.
Researchers from Sentinel One reveal the details of s cryptocurrency mining campaign targeting macOS using a malware called macOS.OSAMiner, using run-only AppleScript files to avoid detections.
A security researcher reveals that a hacker took control of people's internet-connected chastity cages and demanded a ransom to be paid in Bitcoin to unlock it.
The personal information of roughly 2,550 people is compromised by a “phishing” attack on the email account of an employee at Jefferson Healthcare.
Target Class: Q Human health and social work activities

Description: AKVA group reveals in statement on the Oslo Stock Exchange to have been hit by a ransomware attack.

Description: ALTDOS claims to have acquired 8 million records from 3BB a broadband service provider in Thailand.

Description: Microsoft patches 83 vulnerabilities, including CVE-2021-1647, a zero-day vulnerability in the Microsoft Defender antivirus, which Microsoft said was exploited before today's patches were released.

Target: Government institutions and private companies, especially from the energy and metallurgical industries in Colombia
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Operation Spalax, a wave of attacks against companies and government institutions in Colombia with a combination of remote access tools: Remcos, njRAT, and AsyncRAT.

Description: Researchers from Check Point reveal the details of Rogue, a new form of malware combination of two previous families of Android RATs – Cosmos and Hawkshaw.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Facebook says it removed 1,957 Facebook accounts, 707 Instagram accounts, 156 pages and 727 groups last month for misleading users about their purpose and identity.

Target: Victims in the semiconductors and airline industry
Description: Researchers from NCC Group and Fox-IT reveal the details of Chimera, a threat group with a wide set of interests, from intellectual property (IP) from victims in the semiconductors industry through to passenger data from the airline industry.
Researchers from SophosLabs discover a small cluster of Trojanized versions of Android apps, focused on stealing sensitive data from the phones of Pakistani residents.
Unknown hackers disrupt the operations of the Hospital of Horažďovice.

Description: Ultrapar notifies to have been hit by a cyber attack.

As a precaution the company asks a separate group of 47,000 customers to change their password.

Description: A malware attack infects all of Clearfield County’s servers and 15 percent of its computers.

Description: The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns of a wave of attacks where that threat actors bypassed multi-factor authentication (MFA) authentication protocols to compromise cloud service accounts.

Author: At least 40 cybercriminal gangs
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal that at least 40 cybercriminal gangs are using Classiscam, a scam-as-a-service that relies on Telegram bots to provide pages that impersonate popular classifieds, marketplaces, and delivery services.
A new wave of account takeovers for multiple verified Twitter accounts promotes an Elon Musk cryptocurrency giveaway scam.

Target: Multiple organizations in Russia and Hong Kong.

Description: The National Detergent Company in Oman is it by a cyber attack that caused the loss of some data.

Target: Executive roles in companies located primarily in the United States.
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a large BEC campaign (thousands of emails) spoofing executives and attempting to illicit the recipient's support in a bogus merger and/or acquisition, projecting that COVID-19 vaccines would fuel the world's economic recovery.

Target: Dozens of different industries in United States and Canada
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a phishing campaign urging the potential victims to click a link to "confirm their email to receive the vaccine". The goal of this phishing campaign was to steal Office 365 login credentials.

Target: Various industries in the United States
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover another small (under 100 emails) BEC email campaign, picking vaccine lures in an attempt to exploit their targets.

Target: Various industries in the United States
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a medium-sized (several hundred messages) email campaign distributing the  AgentTesla keylogger via fake World Health Organization emails.

Target: Dozens of different industries in the United States, Germany, and Austria

QNAP urges customers to secure their network-attached storage (NAS) devices against Dovecat, an ongoing malware campaign that infects and exploits them to mine bitcoin.

Tags: Red Canary,  BlackByte, ransomware, Microsoft Exchange, ProxyShell, CVE-2021-34473, CVE-2021-34523, CVE-2021-31207

Description: Queensland government-owned energy generator CS Energy is hit with a ransomware attack.
An Omicron COVID-19 campaign is spotted by UK authorities and the National Health Service (NHS) warns about the Omicron COVID-19-themed phishing attacks.
Researchers from Vade Secure discover an ongoing campaign using fake Amazon and Apple invoices.
The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) issues a warning about fake job postings

Target: Conseil des écoles publiques de l’Est de l’Ontario (CEPEO)
Description: The Conseil des écoles publiques de l’Est de l’Ontario (CEPEO) says it was the victim of a ransomware attack and it paid the hackers a ransom to secure the stolen data.
Tags: Conseil des écoles publiques de l’Est de l’Ontario, CEPEO, ransomware

Author: APT Actor from China
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that APT actors from China are now using a novel technique called RTF Template Inject.

Author: APT Actor from Russia
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that APT actors from Russia are now using a novel technique called RTF Template Inject.

Author: APT Actor from India
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that APT actors from India are now using a novel technique called RTF Template Inject.
Planned Parenthood Los Angeles discloses a data breach after suffering a ransomware attack in October that exposed the personal information of approximately 400,000 patients.
Researchers from Cyble discover a fake Android app masquerading as a housekeeping service to steal online banking credentials from the customers of eight Malaysian banks.

Author: Emotet
Description: The Emotet malware is now distributed through malicious Windows App Installer packages that pretend to be Adobe PDF software.
Researchers from Sansec discover NginRAT, a remote access malware that hides on Nginx servers in a way that makes it virtually invisible to security solutions.
Cox Communications discloses a data breach after a hacker impersonated a support agent to gain access to customers' personal information.
Researchers from Check Point uncover a hacking campaign that involves cyberattackers impersonating Iranian government bodies to infect the mobile devices of Iranian citizens through SMS messages.

Author: V_V (anti-vaccination conspiracy movement)
Target: Facebook users in Italy and France
Description:
Meta removes a network of accounts that originated in Italy and France and targeted medical
professionals, journalists, and elected officials with mass harassment.

Author: V_V (anti-vaccination conspiracy movement)
Description: Meta removes a network of accounts that originated in Vietnam for mass reporting against activists and other people who publicly criticized the Vietnamese government.
Meta removes 110 Facebook accounts, 78 Pages, 13 Groups and 17 Instagram accounts from Palestine for  coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Meta removes 31 Facebook accounts, four Groups, two Facebook Events and four Instagram accounts from Poland for  coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Meta removes 38 Facebook accounts, five Groups, and four Instagram accounts in Belarus for  coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Meta removes 595 Facebook accounts, 21 Pages, four Groups and 86 accounts on Instagram from China for  coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Great Plains Manufacturing notifies 4,110 employees that some of their protected health information has potentially been compromised in a cyberattack that was discovered on October 11, 2021.
Blockchain startup MonoX Finance discloses that a hacker stole $31 million by exploiting a bug in software the service uses to draft smart contracts.

Author: APT27 AKA Emissary Panda
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover that an APT is exploiting CVE-2021-44077, an unauthenticated remote code execution issue in Zoho ServiceDesk Plus versions 11305 and older.
Tags: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks,  CVE-2021-44077,  Zoho ServiceDesk Plus

Author: Government of Mexico
Description: Twitter removes a network of 276 inauthentic accounts that shared primarily civic content, in support of government initiatives related to public health and political parties.

Author: People’s Republic of China
Description: Twitter removes a network of 2,048 accounts that amplified Chinese Communist Party narratives related to the treatment of the Uyghur population in Xinjiang. inauthentic accounts that shared primarily civic content, in support of government initiatives related to public health and political parties.

Author: People’s Republic of China
Description: Twitter removes a network of 112 accounts connected to “Changyu Culture,” a private company backed by the Xinjiang regional government.

Author: IRA (Internet Research Agency)
Target: Twitter users in the Central African Republic
Description: Twitter removes a network of 16 accounts linked to the IRA that attempted an information operation in the Central African Republic.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Twitter, IRA Internet Research Agency, Central African Republic, Russia

Author: IRA (Internet Research Agency)
Description: Twitter removes a network of  50 accounts that attacked the civilian Libyan government and actors that support it, while voicing significant support for Russia’s geopolitical position in Libya and Syria.
Tags: Twitter, IRA Internet Research Agency, Libya, Syria, Russia

Author: Tanzania
Description: Twitter removes a network of 268 accounts utilized to file bad faith reports on Twitter, targeting members and supporters of FichuaTanzania and its founder.

Author: Uganda
Description: Twitter removes a network of 418 accounts engaged in coordinated inauthentic activity in support of Ugandan presidential incumbent Museveni and his party, National Resistance Movement (NRM).
Tags: Twitter, Museveni, National Resistance Movement, NRM.

Author: Venezuela
Description: Twitter removes network of 277 Venezuelan accounts that amplified accounts, hashtags, and topics in support of the government and its official narratives via an app called Twitter Patria.

Author: Cuba
Target: At least 49 organizations from US critical infrastructure sectors.
Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) reveals that the Cuba ransomware gang has compromised the networks of at least 49 organizations from US critical infrastructure sectors.
Tags: Federal Bureau of Investigation, FBI, Cuba,  ransomware

Description: Resarchers from Mailguard discover a persuasive and ongoing series of phishing attacks use fake Office 365 notifications asking the recipients to review blocked spam messages to steal their Microsoft credentials.
Hackers steal an estimated $120 million worth of Bitcoin and Ether assets from Badger, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform.

Author: Magnat
Target: Victims in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia and Nigeria.
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of Magnat, a campaign distributing fake versions of popular software to trick users into downloading three forms of malware.

Author: Tor2Mine
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover a new variant of the Tor2Mine miner using a PowerShell script that attempts to disable malware protection, execute a miner payload and harvest Windows credentials

Author: Cuba
Target: At least 49 entities in five critical sectors in the U.S
Description: The FBI warns that the Cuba ransomware gang has compromised at least 49 entities in five critical sectors in the U.S. as of November.

Target: Members of the United States military and their families
Description: Researchers at Lookout identify a phishing campaign targeting members of the United States military and their families.

Target: At least nine U.S. State Department employees
Description: The iPhones of at least nine U.S. State Department employees were hacked by an unknown assailant using the spyware developed by the Israel-based NSO Pegasus.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: BRATA
Description: Researchers from Cleafy discover a campaign in Italy exploiting the  BRATA Android remote access trojan (RAT), with threat actors calling victims of SMS attacks to steal their online banking credentials.

Tags: firm Bansley and Kiener LLP, ransomware

Description: Riverhead Central School District is hit with a ransomware attack.
Ulss 6 Euganea (a local national health unit) is hit with a cyber attack.
At least 18 fake birth certificates are generated in Hisar, after the Health Department is hacked.

Description: Cryptocurrency exchange reveals that it was hacked for $150 million.
Researchers from Red Canary reveal that threat actors are distributing altered KMSpico installers to infect Windows devices with malware that steals cryptocurrency wallets.

Author: RedLine
Description: Cybercriminals are spamming website contact forms and discussion forums to distribute Excel XLL files that download and install the RedLine password and information-stealing malware.
Approximately 330 SPAR shops in northern England face severe operational problems following a weekend cyberattack, forcing many stores to close or switch to cash-only payments.
A cyberattack takes Maryland’s health department offline.

Author: Nobelium
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the Nobelium hacking group continues to breach government and enterprise networks worldwide by targeting their cloud and managed service providers and using a new custom "Ceeloader" malware.

Description: The French national cyber-security agency ANSSI (Agence Nationale de la Sécurité des Systèmes d'Information)says that the Russian-backed Nobelium hacking group has been targeting French organizations since February 2021.

Author: Nickel (AKA KE3CHANG, APT15, Vixen Panda, Royal APT, and Playful Dragon)

Tags: Microsoft, Nickel, KE3CHANG, APT15, Vixen Panda, Royal APT, Playful Dragon

Author: Conti
Description: Nordic Choice Hotels confirms a cyber attack on its systems from the Conti ransomware group.

Author: Moobot
Description: Researchers from Fortinet reveal that a Mirai-based botnet called 'Moobot' is spreading aggressively via exploiting a critical command injection flaw in the webserver of many Hikvision products.

Researchers from Gemini Advisory reveal that threat actors have abused a legitimate feature of the Google Tag Manager service to secretly add and deploy malicious JavaScript code to more than 300 e-commerce stores since March this year.

Author: HelloKitty
Description: The Oregon Anesthesiology Group (OAG) said it suffered a ransomware attack in July that led to the breach of the personal information of 750,000 patients and 522 current and former OAG employees.

Description: Google announces that it has taken action to disrupt the Glupteba botnet that controls more than 1 million Windows PCs around the world, growing by thousands of new infected devices each day.
QNAP warns customers today of ongoing attacks targeting their NAS devices with a cryptomining malware (oom_reaper), urging them to take measures to protect them immediately.

Author: Cerber
Description: The Cerber ransomware is back, as a new ransomware family with the old name, and targets Atlassian Confluence and GitLab servers using remote code execution vulnerabilities (respectively CVE-2021-26084 and CVE-2021-22205 for Confluence and GitLab)

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that US universities are being targeted in multiple phishing attacks, using COVID-19 Omicron lures, designed to impersonate college login portals to steal valuable Office 365 credentials.
Tags: Proofpoint, US universities, Office 365, COVID-19, Omicron

Author: XE Group
Description: Researchers from Volexity reveal the details of XE Group, a Vietnamese-origin criminal threat actor linked to eight years of for-profit hacking and credit card skimming.

Author: Emotet
Description: The Emotet malware starts to install Cobalt Strike beacons directly, giving immediate network access to threat actors and facilitating ransomware attacks.
Sound Generations announces that unauthorized individuals have gained access to its internal systems and have used ransomware to encrypt files in two separate attacks.
Saltzer Health reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.

Tags: Rhode Island Public Transit Authority, RIPTA

Author: UAE Government
Target: Hanan Elatr, wife of deceased Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that the UAE used the NSO Group's Pegasus trojan to hack and track the phone of Hanan Elatr, wife of deceased Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
Tags: Citizen Lab, NSO Group, Pegasus, Hanan Elatr, Jamal Khashoggi.

Description: Monongalia Health System suffers a data breach resulting from a phishing attack, which gave hackers access to several email accounts.
The UK National Crime Agency (NCA) and National Cyber Crime Unit (NCCU discover and donate to the community a 225 million cache of stolen emails and passwords.
Tags: UK National Crime Agency, NCA, National Cyber Crime Unit, NCCU

Description: Researchers from Sophos release details of a novel exploit that bypasses a patch for the critical vulnerability CVE-2021-40444 affecting the Microsoft Office file format, to install the Formbook malware.
The British Council has fallen victim to two successful ransomware attacks over the past five years.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Luxemburg-Casco School District discloses a data security incident that resulted in unauthorized access to 1,399 individuals’ personal information.
The Monterey Peninsula Unified School District notifies current and former employees of a data security incident that they discovered on or about November 1.

Author: Dridex
Description: A new Dridex malware phishing campaign is using fake employee termination emails as a lure to open a malicious Excel document, which then trolls the victim with a season's greeting message.

Author: Avos Locker
Description: A report from Sophos reveals that the AvosLocker ransomware gang has started focusing on disabling endpoint security solutions by rebooting compromised systems into Windows Safe Mode.
Researchers from Cofense discover a new phishing campaign targeting CoinSpot cryptocurrency exchange users
A massive data breach exposes the data on the salaries and personal information of 637,138 Albanian residents working in the private and public sectors.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Elastic Security uncover a stealthy malware campaign that leverages valid code signing certificates to evade detection. The campaign is also used to drop a second stage payload called BLISTER.

Researchers from Cyble discover a new Android banking trojan targeting Itaú Unibanco and using a fake Google Play page to trick visitors into thinking they are installing the app from a trustworthy service.
Tags: Cyble, Android,  Itaú Unibanco,  Google Play

Author: Rook
Description: Researchers from SentinelOne discover a new ransomware operation named Rook, derived from the leaked Babuk ransomware code.

Author: Polish Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that Polish Senator Krzysztof Brejza was hacked using the NSO Group's Pegasus spyware 33 times between April 26, 2019 and October 23, 2019.
Tags: Citizen Lab,  Krzysztof Brejza, NSO Group, Pegasus

Author: Polish Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that Pegasus was also used to hack into the phones of Polish prosecutor Ewa Wrzosek and Roman Giertych, a lawyer for Brejza's party Civic Platform.
Tags: Citizen Lab,  Ewa Wrzosek, NSO Group, Pegasus

Author: Polish Government?
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that Pegasus was also used to hack into the phones of Polish prosecutor Ewa Wrzosek and Roman Giertych, a lawyer for Brejza's party Civic Platform.
Tags: Citizen Lab,  Roman Giertych, NSO Group, Pegasus

Description: Researchers from ReasonLabs discover a campaign inserting Monero miners to the Russian torrent files of the "Spider-Man: No Way Home" movie.
USCellular discloses a data breach after the company's billing system was hacked in December 2021 when the company detected an unauthorized access.
Researchers from Safeguard reveal that attackers are targeting crypto-wallets of Telegram users with the Echelon infostealer.

Author: Conti
Description: Photography and personalized photo giant Shutterfly suffers a Conti ransomware attack.

Author: Dridex
Description: A new Dridex malware phishing campaign exploits the Omicron COVID-19 variant lure.

ONUS, one of the largest Vietnamese crypto trading platforms, suffers a cyber attack on its payment system running a vulnerable Log4j version. The threat actors approached ONUS to extort a $5 million sum.
Capital Region Medical Center (CRMC) confirms it was the victim of a cyber attack.
Weddell Pediatric Dental Specialists notifies 5,356 individuals that an unauthorized individual gained access to an employee’s email account that contained their protected health information.
Duneland School Corporation notifies employees and dependents of a data breach.
The German Pharmacists’ Association (DAV) is the target of a phishing attack aimed to falsify vaccination data.

Author: eCh0raix AKA QNAPCrypt
Description: Users of QNAP NAS devices report attacks on their systems with the eCh0raix ransomware, also known as QNAPCrypt.
Several malicious campaigns are abusing the Microsoft Build Engine (MSBuild) to execute a Cobalt Strike payload on compromised systems.
Tags: Microsoft Build Engine, MSBuild, Cobalt Strike

Description: Florida Digestive Health Specialists LLP notifies more than 212,500 individuals of a December 2020 breach involving business email compromise and fraud.

Author: BlackTech
Description: Researchers from NTT Security detect the BlackTech cyber-espionage APT group targeting Japanese companies using a novel malware that researchers call ‘Flagpro’.
T-Mobile confirms that recent reports of a new data breach are linked to notifications sent to a "very small number of customers" who fell victim to SIM swap attacks.
Many LastPass users report that their master passwords have been compromised after receiving email warnings that someone tried to use them to log into their accounts from unknown locations.
Amedia, the largest local news publisher in Norway, announces that several of its central computer systems were shut down in what it is calling an apparent “serious” cyberattack.

Researchers from Amnpardaz, an Iranian security company, discover iLOBleed, a rootkit that hides inside the firmware of HP iLO devices and which has been used in real-world attacks to wipe servers of Iranian organizations.

Author: AQUATIC PANDA
Description: Researchers from Crowdstrike reveal that the threat actor dubbed AQUATIC PANDA is trying to exploit the Log4Shell  CVE 2021-44228 vulnerability.
Brown County confirms a malware security breach occurred on August 2021.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority (SLGA) reports that it has temporarily disabled certain computer systems and applications, as it investigates a cybersecurity incident that occurred on Dec. 25.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority, SLGA

Author: Avos Locker
Description: The Avos Locker ransomware operation provides a free decryptor after learning they encrypted a US government agency.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Aquasec reveal the details of a cryptomining campaign targeting misconfigured Docker APIs and able to avoid detection since 2019.
Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Police is hit by an apparent cyberattack and data is put up for sale on the internet.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Crawford County Assessor’s Office is hit by a cyberattack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Donnelley & Sons, a vendor of NJ Office of Information Technology suffers a cyber attack and all the activity is affected.
U.S. online store PulseTV discloses a large-scale customer credit card compromise with more than 200,000 shoppers impacted.
The Gloucester City Council suffers a cyber attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
